channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Ministers squirm as they insist Dominic Cummings did NOT break rules
item.description: Two witness testimonies have taken a sledgehammer to the Downing Street aide's insistence he 'stayed put' at his parents' farm in the Durham.

item.title: Donald Trump is seen golfing for the first time since the outbreak began and shakes hands on course
item.description: President Trump enjoyed a leisurely start to Memorial Day weekend as he arrived at his Trump National Golf Club in Virginia Saturday for a round on the course.

item.title: Coronavirus cases 'doubled every three days to 1.5m' in the UK
item.description: On March 3 the number of cases was 14,000. This was the day the government was warned about their mitigation approach. By the time lockdown was imposed, cases hit 1.5 million.

item.title: US coronavirus pandemic could be over as early as November, predictive model shows
item.description: A complex model developed by Singapore University of Technology and Design predicts the exact date the pandemic will end in the US, UK, and other countries around the world.
item.media:credit: Singapore University of Technology and Design

item.title: North Korean TV erases Kim Jong Un's emblem from various programmes after his official title change
item.description: North Korean TV removed the emblem from several features about Kim and a daily propaganda video after his title change from Supreme Commander to head of state and Commander-in-Chief.

item.title: We reveal how buffet restaurants will have to adapt post-lockdown
item.description: With the coronavirus pandemic changing the way we conduct our everyday lives, will buffet-style restaurants even be able to open again?

item.title: Japanese Netflix Terrace House reality TV star Hana Kimura is found dead aged 22
item.description: Hana Kimura is best known for appearing in Netflix show Terrace House. Her cause of death is not yet known however she had concerned fans with a string of troubling posts in recent days.

item.title: Back to Benidorm in JULY! Spanish PM tells tourists 'we're waiting for you'
item.description: Spain will open up its borders in just over a month's time giving hope to Britons wanting to spend their summer in the Costas, Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez confirmed.

item.title: JK Rowling slams Dominic Cummings' 'indefensible hypocrisy'
item.description: The Harry Potter author took to social media today to criticise the Prime Minister's chief advisor, after he drove 260 miles from London to Durham in March despite clear Government restrictions.

item.title: Coronavirus mass graves in Brazil shown in aerial shots as country records 21,116 deaths
item.description: Brazil was the world's second worst affected country before Russia recorded 335,882 infections today. Aerial video showed rows of open plots at the Formosa Cemetery in Sao Paulo.

item.title: Britons are urged to stay away from beaches today with dry, sunny weather and 66F highs
item.description: Emergency services were scrambled to Clevedon in Somerset at 8pm last night after a man who drove from Birmingham for a day at the beach got cut off by a rapidly rising River Severn.

item.title: 'I couldn't even hug my father at my mother's funeral': Twitter slams 'hypocrite' Dominic Cummings
item.description: The Prime Minister's chief aide caused a stir when it emerged last night he'd travelled all the way from London to Durham, despite clear restrictions ordering people to stay at home.

item.title: Shocking moment speeding car smashes into parked vehicles down a quiet residential street
item.description: In the video, the car can be seen coming down the Preston street at break-neck speed. The driver loses control of the car, swerving into one parked car which causes the car to flip a full 180 degrees.

item.title: Police carry bags of clothes and a carpet from flat where Louise Smith, 16, was last staying
item.description: Forensic offers have been searching properties in Havant, Hampshire after a body was found in nearby woodland as they searched for 16-year-old Louise Smith, who vanished on May 8.

item.title: Britons line up to buy takeaway alcohol as bars reopen over bank holiday weekend
item.description: Sunseekers across the country have been treated to their first pint in weeks today as bars throughout the UK opened up their bars to serve takeaway drinks for the Bank Holiday weekend.

item.title: 'Distressed' dog is found panting in a parked car in 80F heat on the hottest day of the year
item.description: Footage shows a bowl of water was given to a dog in Oakham, Rutland, Leicestershire yesterday which was discovered panting away in a parked car during the hottest day of the year.

item.title: Author Michael Rosen, 74, leaves intensive care after 'long and difficult' eight weeks in hospital
item.description: Author Michael Rosen, has left intensive care after 47 days. Mr Rosen was admitted into Whittington Hospital during the final week of March after suffering from coronavirus-like symptoms.

item.title: Shad Gaspard's heartbroken wife pays tribute to WWE star in beach memorial
item.description: Shad's widow Siliana joined friends, family, fans and loved ones on the LA beach where the hero dad lost his life earlier this week.

item.title: Woman is inundated with confessions from people who are hiding terrible secrets
item.description: Hundreds of Mumsnet users confessed to fraud, affairs and criminal acts after one woman asked if anyone had a secret that would 'ruin their life' if it came to light.

item.title: Health chiefs accuse Boris Johnson and Keir Starmer of using NHS as a scapegoat in blame game
item.description: Boris Johnson and Sir Keir Starmer have been accused of using the NHS as a scapegoat in the back-and-forth coronavirus blame game over the large number of deaths at care homes.

item.title: Sports halls 'could become makeshift courtrooms' for family and commercial hearings
item.description: The head of the judiciary in England and Wales Lord Burnett of Maldon (pictured) told MPs yesterday that venues which are shut could be used for civil cases.

item.title: Emmerdale and Coronation Street stars 'fear they will be axed from soaps amid the COVID-19 crisis'
item.description: A celebrity agent speaking to The Sun on Saturday claimed that they had been contacted by 'several people' asking for work as they fear fewer stars will be asked to come back to the show.

item.title: Publication of Professor Neil Ferguson's latest model is delayed for WEEKS
item.description: The Imperial team was thrust into the spotlight when its most prominent scientist, Professor Neil Ferguson (pictured), flouted lockdown rules - which he had a heavy hand in imposing.

item.title: Covid home test kits that give results in an HOUR will be available for public to buy in weeks
item.description: The DnaNudge test does not require any medical expertise and can detect the virus from just a nostril sample - much less invasive than some throat swabs.

item.title: Government pumps £283m into public transport and provides £50 bike repair vouchers for cyclists
item.description: The Transport Secretary said today the cash injection would increase both frequency and capacity of services while ensuring there is enough space on vehicles to allow for social distancing.

item.title: European fury at Britain's chaotic quarantine rules with French leading outrage
item.description: France immediately hit back at the UK's new quarantine plans last night, saying it 'regretted' the decision and would look to impose a 'reciprocal measure' on Brits arriving at its borders.

item.title: Herd-immunity NOT working in Sweden: Study finds just 7% of people in Stockholm had Covid antibodies
item.description: The country's decision not to impose lockdown was championed by Chief Epidemiologist Anders Tegnell. Sweden has the most Covid-19 deaths per capita in Europe over the last week.

item.title: Cabin map of where survivors were sitting when PIA Airbus plowed into houses in Karachi killing 97
item.description: Two men survived the devastating crash in Karachi yesterday - the President of the Bank of Punjab, Zafar Masud, and an engineer named Mohammad Zubair, 24.

item.title: Britain announces hundreds more coronavirus deaths
item.description: Today's death toll - which takes into account all settings - is the lowest recorded on a Saturday since March 21 (56), three days before the UK went into lockdown.

item.title: Former investment banker becomes YouTube hit after posting videos of him completing SUDOKU puzzles
item.description: Simon Anthony, 46, from Reigate, Surrey, has become a sensation with his YouTube channel Cracking the Cryptic, which has more than 210,000 subscribers worldwide.

item.title: Tampax SLAMMED for their latest television advert for tampons
item.description: Tampax has been slammed for its 'tampons and tea' television advert in the UK. Social media users have blasted the campaign, which has been aired during family-friendly shows as 'cringe-worthy'.

item.title: Fake ID papers used by Nazi SS leader Heinrich Himmler are unearthed 75 years after his death
item.description: The fake documents, vital to Himmler's capture on May 22, 1945, were found in the possessions of a judge and have been donated to the Military Intelligence Museum in Shefford, Bedfordshire.

item.title: Malaga swimmer comes within inches of huge basking shark off Spain's coast
item.description: A spectacular video shows an unfazed swimmer come within inches of a huge basking shark off the coast of Malaga on Friday. This is the third sighting off Spain's southern waters this month.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle celebrated their second wedding anniversary with margaritas
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle celebrated their second wedding anniversary with an LA favourite - Mexican food and margaritas, royal biographer Omid Scobie has revealed.

item.title: First-ever study into Italians' genetic diversity reveals it dates back 19,000 years ago
item.description: Experts dissected the evolutionary history of Italians for the first time, revealing their diversity dates back to 19,000 years ago. Northern Italians have more ties to France, while southern to Africa.

item.title: Fortnum and Mason reopens its Piccadilly department store's food halls as staff wear face masks
item.description: The company reopened its London headquarters' ground and lower ground floor food halls on Thursday. It opened from 11am to 7pm and in-store bars and restaurants were shut as staff wore PPE.

item.title: Alligator called Saturn who was rumoured to have belonged to Hitler dies at Moscow Zoo aged 84
item.description: Known to have been a pre-war star attraction at Berlin Zoo in Nazi Germany, the story also circulated that Saturn had been in Hitler's personal pet collection.

item.title: Tricky quiz puts the nation's knowledge of phrases used in the tech industry to the test
item.description: Online smartphone retailer e2save have collated a selection of tech questions that feature in the UK's school curriculum. They claim less than one in ten people are able to achieve a perfect score.

item.title: Durham is the most affordable place to buy a house in UK while Oxford is most unaffordable
item.description: Oxford, the City of Westminster and Cambridge are the three least affordable cities to buy home, whereas Durham, Stoke-on-Trent and Hull are the most affordable cities in the UK.

item.title: Amateur bakers reveal how to make indulgent red velvet mugcakes
item.description: Amateur bakers have been sharing their attempts at making red velvet cake in a mug on Instagram. A social media user from India, took to YouTube with a recipe for the one minute bake.

item.title: Boris Johnson plans to reduce Huawei's involvement in Britain's 5G network 'to zero'
item.description: Boris Johnson has reportedly told officials he wants to reduce China's involvement in UK infrastructure. China has come under widespread criticism during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: US Navy shows off high-energy LASER WEAPON and shoots down a drone during its first ever at-sea test
item.description: The US Navy shot down a drone with a high-energy laser attached to the USS Portland near Pearl Harbor in Hawaii

item.title: Moment boy, 9, weeps with joy as he tucks into his first McDonald's after months of lockdown
item.description: Adam Bin Mohammad Irwan from Singapore was overcome with emotion after seeing the meal. Mum Wati shared the video on Facebook, it has been viewed over 73,000 times.

item.title: Welsh nationalist MP Jonathan Edwards is expelled after being arrested on suspicion of assault
item.description: Welsh nationalist MP Jonathan Edwards (pictured), who has represented Carmarthen East and Dinefwr since 2010, was arrested on Wednesday.

item.title: Two burglars suspected of torturing Portuguese rapper Mota Jr 'have fled to the UK'
item.description: European arrest warrants have been issued for two of the three men suspected of torturing Portuguese rapper Moto Jr after it was reported they fled to Britain following the murder.

item.title: Volvo will use electronic speed limiters to keep all new cars from going faster than 112mph
item.description: Every new Volvo sold from now on will have a maximum speed of 112mph, or 180kph in Europe, as part of the company's efforts to reduce auto fatalities and comply with EU law.

item.title: Two-thirds of Britons have piled on the pounds during lockdown
item.description: According to the survey of 1,000 Britons, a third of the population has gained half a stone or more in the eight weeks since all but essential travel was banned. Obesity spikes the risk of dying from Covid.

item.title: George Osborne, 49, is dating former chief of staff who oversaw his image make-over as Chancellor
item.description: Mr Osborne revealed he is in a relationship with Thea Rogers, who also worked as his special adviser when he was in government. Pictured: The pair in 2015.

item.title: Travel firms are ALREADY planning to exploit Dublin loophole in 14-day quarantine
item.description: Priti Patel's plans for a tough new quarantine regime requiring almost all arrivals into the UK to immediately self-isolate for 14 days has been labelled 'ineffective' due to the 'Dublin dodge' loophole.

item.title: Rishi Sunak tells Tory MPs Italy and Greece are 'opening up' economies
item.description: In a call with Conservative backbenchers, Chancellor Rishi Sunak made the point that Greece and Italy were already 'opening up' their economies.

item.title: Jeremy Clarkson reveals The Grand Tour producer Andy Willman suffered a relapse of coronavirus
item.description: The Grand Tour producer had Covid-19 six weeks ago but still suffers the effects. Wilman, 57, says the coronavirus pandemic stopped the show's trip to Russia and slowed editing of the Madagascar special.

item.title: Pregnancy warning as study finds Covid 'injures' the placenta and cuts off blood to unborn babies
item.description: WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT. Researchers from Northwestern University, in Illinois, said the findings 'worried them'. Scientists found visible damage in the placentas of all 15 mothers in the study.

item.title: Former Fulham striker Pavel Pogrebnyak tests positive for coronavirus
item.description: Maria Pogrebnyak-Shatalova, 31, said she thinks her husband Pavel caught the virus at training. Pogrebnyak currently plays for football club Ural Yekaterinburg in Russia.

item.title: Great-grandmother, 88, becomes TikTok star
item.description: Ruth Rudd has gone viral by doing funny dancing videos outside her house in Kidderminster and scoring a goal in her granddaughter's football which has over 500,000 views.

item.title: Police officer given warning for failing to find drugs in hotel George Kay was 'eating cocaine'
item.description: A Cheshire Police misconduct hearing into George Kay's death on July 6, 2019, has concluded with a police officer receiving a written warning for 'failing to take positive action'.

item.title: Fugitive drug trafficker who was on the run for seven years is arrested by police on 45th birthday
item.description: David John Walley had been wanted by the NCA for trafficking cocaine and MDMA, and possessing a false ID, since 2013, but was finally arrested on Thursday by Greater Manchester Police.

item.title: Celebrity fortune teller reveals how to read your own palm from home
item.description: Exlusive: Celebrity fortune teller Chris Riley, 25, from Essex, revealed the secret to reading your palm at home, and shared the meaning behind a short life line and the creases at the side of your fist.

item.title: Piers Morgan issues ultimatum to Boris Johnson by telling him to sack Dominic Cummings TODAY
item.description: The Good Morning Britain star issued the ultimatum to the PM on Twitter. Dominic Cummings stands accused of breaking Government rules by travelling to his parents home in Durham.

item.title: Briton films rare COVID-19 documentary showing ordinary Chinese people under draconian lockdown
item.description: Yu Kung, a former London advertising executive, used his camera to record his neighbours dealing with unprecedented life changes in Shanghai after the killer infection erupted in the Far East.

item.title: Employers will have to pay a quarter of the wages of furloughed staff from August
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak last week extended the furlough scheme but said firms must cover a proportion of wages. He is expected to announce that governments must pay 25 per cent.

item.title: Labour leader Keir Starmer says he will NOT try to rejoin the EU
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer said the only focus now was 'what sort of a deal we have with the EU and what sort of deals we have with the rest of the world'.

item.title: Huge 20ft wide sinkhole swallows up part of busy street in Walsall after sewer collapse
item.description: Drivers were forced to swerve around the 20ft-wide hole which opened up when a sewer collapsed on Stafford Street, in Walsall, West Midlands., on Thursday.

item.title: Father-of-three is left paralysed after food poisoning on holiday to the Dominican Republic
item.description: William Marsh, 57, from Mountain Ash, Wales, was in a coma for 10 weeks and spent seven months in hospital after falling ill from suspected food poisoning on a holiday to the Dominican Republic.

item.title: Dominic Cummings' wife described how he 'collapsed and had spasms'
item.description: Journalist Mary Wakefield revealed that No10 chief Mr Cummings, 48, spent 10 days bedridden after 'collapsing' and having 'spasms' with the disease at the end of March.

item.title: Prisoners should be used as guinea pigs for experimental Covid vaccines, says pro-Putin politician
item.description: Vladimir Zhirinovsky said thousands of Russian prisoners would respond to the deal. Zhirinovsky, who's leader of the Liberal Democratic Party's, plan has sparked angry response.

item.title: Georgian mansion where Blither Spirit was filmed for sale
item.description: Buckinghamshire's seven-bedroom, four-bathroom Denham Mount was designed by famous 19th century architect, Robert Lugar, who became known as 'the county gentleman's architect'.

item.title: Trump administration is considering first nuclear weapons test since 1992
item.description: A senior administration official told The Washington Post Friday that discussions about a potential test took place on Friday May 15.

item.title: Troops blast Santiago crowds with rubber bullets as riots break out in Chilean capital
item.description: Anti-government protests were sparked in October in the Chilean capital Santiago when the metro fare was raised - amid increasing frustration at the high cost of living and low wages.

item.title: Amazon opens new 63,000-sq ft family shelter inside one of its Seattle headquarters office buildings
item.description: Amazon has opened a purpose-built permanent homeless shelter inside its downtown Seattle headquarters. It comes as employees of the internet giant have been working from home.

item.title: Boris Johnson vows to have a test and trace system ready on Thursday
item.description: The Prime Minister suggested at cabinet on Thursday that a test and trace system would be in place by next Thursday, but would not be 'all singing, all dancing'.

item.title: Elvis Presley's rhinestone studded jockstrap bearing his initials goes up for sale for £30,000
item.description: The jockstrap was custom-made by an Elvis fan and was worn by the King right up until he died in 1977. It is part of Celebrity memorabilia experts Paul Fraser Collectables' Elvis Presley collection.

item.title: Michael Jordan lied about several things in 'The Last Dance' claims 'Jordan Rules' author Sam Smith
item.description: NBA legend Michael Jordan has been accused of making up and lying about several things during ESPN and Netflix's hugely popular documentary series 'The Last Dance'.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson invites Natalie Pinkham to host her 'Storytime with Fergie and Friends'
item.description: Natalie Pinkham joined Sarah Ferguson's daily 'Storytime with Fergie and Friends' YouTube series to read Lost and Found by Oiver Jeffers on Friday night.

item.title: Mike Tindall reveals they are sending Mia, 6, back to school in Junes
item.description: Mike Tindall has described homeschooling his daughter Mia, 6, as 'nice but also frustrating', in a candid interview with the Telegraph about life in isolation.

item.title: Pictured: Fugitive British 'drug dealer', 28, arrested by police over Costa del Sol bar knife fight
item.description: Zathon Dale Williams, 28, from Bedworth, Warwickshire, was arrested after a bar knife fight at Steve's Bar in Mijas Costa, southern Spain, along with five other Brits.

item.title: Four men and a woman appear in court charged with drive-by shooting murder of Aya Hachem
item.description: The four defendants, from Blackburn and Great Harwood, spoke only to confirm their name and address when they appeared at Preston Magistrates' Court (pictured, Aya Hachem).

item.title: Why BROWN is the new grey
item.description: Paints in shades ranging from toffee to mahogany are proving increasingly popular with leading British interior designers, according to experts at House and Garden.

item.title: Michelin-starred restaurant Noma swaps 20-course £300 meals with £20 burgers during lockdown
item.description: A world famous, Michelin-starred restaurant is doing its best to adapt during these unprecedented times and has taken the bold step of becoming a takeaway burger joint.

item.title: Keir Starmer reveals his children have attended school throughout lockdown
item.description: The Labour leader said his 11-year-old son and nine-year-old daughter were still going to state school in Camden, north London as his wife Victoria (pictured) is an NHS key worker.

item.title: What ex-Home Secretary Amber Rudd really thinks of her 29-year-old daughter's VERY public sex life
item.description: Amber Rudd's daughter Flora Gill (pictured) - whose father was controversial food critic A.A. Gill - has picked up the family mantle of shock journalism.

item.title: Some 130,000 older married women may be owed £100m in state pension
item.description: Around 130,000 married women could be missing out on a bigger state pension, an investigation has revealed. It is feared that older married women may be owed up to £100million.

item.title: $2 magic shaving powder that removes hair in minutes goes viral on TikTok
item.description: SoftSheen-Carson's Magic Shaving Powder has gone viral on TikTok with dozens of users sharing videos of themselves trying it out.

item.title: Dutch Kennel Club becomes first to ban British bulldog
item.description: The kennel's move comes after new laws the Dutch government introduced restricting the breeding of broad-skulled dogs who can suffer issues with breathing, their eyes and spinal conditions.

item.title: Car-rental giant Hertz files for Chapter 11 with $19BILLION of debt
item.description: The Floriday-based firm began bankruptcy protection proceedings in the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Wilmington, Delaware, on Friday..

item.title: Providers reveal an increase in calls on landline phones since lockdown
item.description: TalkTalk says calls made via landline phones in Britain have doubled during the pandemic as Britons turning to traditional methods of communication to stay in touch.

item.title: Source reveals Meghan Markle 'recreated' Botswana trip for Prince Harry's birthday
item.description: Harry turned 35 on September 15, and a source has now revealed to People how Meghan, 38, planned a sweet surprise for him to celebrate.

item.title: Joe Biden APOLOGIZES for telling radio host Charlamagne tha God for 'you ain't black' comment
item.description: Joe Biden apologized to black business leaders for telling popular radio show host Charlamagne tha God that he 'ain't black' if he can't discern the better presidential candidate.

item.title: Police investigate death of unborn baby after woman took abortion drugs at home at 28 weeks pregnant
item.description: The woman was four weeks past the legal termination limit in the UK and 18 weeks past the ten-week limit for taking the abortion pills at home under new measures.

item.title: Top chefs reveal their perfect bank holiday banquets, from the dream dishes to what you should avoid
item.description: Small and perfectly formed or sprawling spreads - whatever the size, all good picnics should make you feel as if you've packed a holiday into a hamper.

item.title: High noon at high table: Dean of Christ Church, Oxford, refuses to resign
item.description: All academic institutions like to think of themselves as a cut above. But there is probably no institution in Britain quite as grand as Christ Church, Oxford.

item.title: How a Japanese cult tested nerve gas on sheep at an Australian Outback property before fatal attack
item.description: Members of the Aum Supreme Truth sect flew from Tokyo to Perth in April 1993 looking for a remote location where they could test sarin gas ahead of a terrorist attack that shocked the world.

item.title: Two metre rule could be relaxed raising hopes more pubs and restaurants will be able to reopen
item.description: Professor Yvonne Doyle told MPs that the UK had taken a 'cautionary' approach to introducing the rule when other countries were using shorter distances.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: All arrivals must quarantine for 14 days
item.description: Priti Patel today confirmed all travellers returning to the UK will face a mandatory 14 day period in quarantine as she said Britain must now guard against importing cases of coronavirus.

item.title: Arsenal star Sead Kolasinac's wife, 27, was caught trying to bring stun gun into UK
item.description: Bella Kolasinac bought the stun gun after becoming 'very ­security conscious' after her husband and his teammate Mesut Ozil were attacked by knife-wielding motorbike riders last July

item.title: Baroness Warsi drops two stone and beats diabetes for the sake of the NHS
item.description: Today, looking trim in a size 12 dress, Baroness Warsi is two stone lighter. She is no longer pre-diabetic and has reduced her blood pressure medication.

item.title: Chelsea Flower Show announces amateur gardener winners
item.description: Nearly 8,000 people entered the society's 'My Chelsea Garden' competition. Terry Winters, 62, from Wiltshire, won the prize for Best Back Garden (pictured).

item.title: Unprecedented heat wave hits the Arctic, raising temperatures to 86 degrees this week
item.description: An unprecedented heat wave has the Arctic in its grips. The event is caused by a strong high pressure system moving in from Siberia that has been intensified by climate change.

item.title: HPV vaccine could reduce risk of premature births, study shows
item.description: Australian researchers say the HPV vaccine could have further-reaching benefits by lowering the risk of adverse pregnancy outcomes (APOs) in vaccinated women.

item.title: Children in care can be vaccinated against parents' wishes
item.description: Lady Justice King and Lords Justice McCombe and Peter Jackson made the ruling in a Court of Appeal today after London's Tower Hamlets Council went to the High Court.

item.title: Ribs evolved for walking before breathing, new study reveals
item.description: University of Utah researchers made X-ray and CT movement scans of different types of modern lizards to see how important ribs were in the way they walk.

item.title: Arctic birds weaken their own immune systems to save energy
item.description: Weakening their system opens the birds up to health risks, but makes them more energy efficient which also helps when hunting, according to the team from Lund University.
